JobPositionInformation.PositionTitle: Finnish Supply Chain Specialist for L’Oréal
JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
Do you speak Finnish and want to work for a market leader in an international and dynamic environment? Are you ready to take on responsibility, and do you have a flair for managing complex processes and effective communication?
On behalf of our client, L’Oréal, we are looking for a Supply Chain Specialist to join L’Oréal’s Operations department in Havneholmen as soon as possible. This is a temporary 9-month position through StudentConsulting, with the possibility of extension or direct employment at L’Oréal for the right candidate

Your Role:
As a Supply Chain Specialist, you will manage the order-to-cash process for assigned customers in the Finnish market. Your responsibilities include coordinating all activities from order collection to customer invoicing while ensuring smooth communication both externally and internally.

Key Responsibilities:
• Acting as the main point of contact for assigned customers
• Proactively managing customer relationships
• Processing orders and invoices
• Handling customer claims and credit notes
• Managing internal and external communication regarding customer-specific issues
• Preparing customer-specific reports and performing other relevant tasks
• Facilitating structured communication and collaboration within logistics, sales, and other internal stakeholders

What we are looking for:
If you are excited about working in an international environment and are eager to develop both your technical and interpersonal skills, you might be the perfect fit for this position.

• You have strong organizational skills and can prioritize tasks efficiently, keeping deadlines and service standards in mind
• You have a solid understanding of Supply Chain processes, especially the order-to-cash process
• You are proactive, take initiative, and are results-oriented
• You have excellent communication skills
• You are IT-savvy; SAP experience is a plus but not mandatory
• You are fluent in Finnish and English; proficiency in another Nordic language is an advantage but not required

Practical Information:
• Start Date: As soon as possible
• Employment Type: Full-time (37 hours per week)
• Location: Copenhagen
• Salary: Fixed basic salary + pension + discretionary benefits

This is your chance to prove yourself and start your career in a global organization. If this opportunity sounds exciting to you, please send your resume and application as soon as possible. The recruitment process will close once we find the right candidate.

For further information, please contact recruitment consultant Monika Thomsen at monika.thomsen@studentconsulting.com.

We look forward to receiving your application!
